Warren violence must come to an end
DEAR EDITOR: In the early hours of Easter morning, our family heard gunshots outside our northeast-side home.

DEAR EDITOR:
On Jan. 18, the U.S. Supreme Court informed the Delphi retirees that it would not hear our case, thereby ending a 12-year legal battle.
If he thinks he can win a U.S. Senate seat, he should produce real results for the work-hard, play-by-the-rules people he represents.
Our local U.S. Rep. Tim Ryan, D-Howland, has failed miserably in the 12 years we have been in this fight.
We hard-working, play-by-the-rules retirees were cast aside by the legal branch of our government.
Tim Ryan claims to stand up for working people, yet he has produced no real results.
Since 2003, his record of representing Ohio’s working folk has been dismal at best.
Just ask the 35,000 local ex-UAW and IUE union people what Ryan did for them.
They, too, were the “working people” Ryan failed over the years.
Waiting for Congress to pass legislation to right the wrong.
